intro: Hieracium holopleurum, commonly known as the hairy hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and opposite leaf arrangement. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring hairy stems and basal leaves that are lanceolate in shape. Its flowers are yellow, arranged in a flat-topped inflorescence, and bloom from late spring to early summer. Hieracium holopleurum is often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, and it plays a role in supporting local pollinators.
